Line 112: Line 112:
==Scenario==
==Scenario==
â
[[Image:1.1 - Keep On Running.jpg|thumb|right|200px|John Challis and Paul Barber in the first episode.]]
 
Boycie ([[John Challis]]) is initially on the run from infamous London villains the Driscoll Brothers, and his only hope of living to old age is to escape before they catch up with him. So overnight he moves with his reluctant wife Marlene ([[Sue Holderness]]) and dim-witted teenage son Tyler ([[Jack Doolan]]) to a secluded farm in Shropshire, where he hopes they'll be safe.
Boycie ([[John Challis]]) is initially on the run from infamous London villains the Driscoll Brothers, and his only hope of living to old age is to escape before they catch up with him. So overnight he moves with his reluctant wife Marlene ([[Sue Holderness]]) and dim-witted teenage son Tyler ([[Jack Doolan]]) to a secluded farm in Shropshire, where he hopes they'll be safe.
Line 121: Line 120:
Also in the second series, Boycie ran for Mayor with the help of Elgin's dyslexic reporter and Jed's ugly kids. Llewellyn lost a pub quiz to Boycie when Tyler answered all of the questions correctly - much to the surprise of his parents. Mrs Cakeworthy started her on psychic sessions in the Manor House, and the Driscoll brothers found Boycie, with the help of Marlene's sister who had been dating them both. The Driscolls did not harm Boycie but stated that he and his family will be left untouched if they can use Boycie's land to hide something on. What they buried is still unknown.
Also in the second series, Boycie ran for Mayor with the help of Elgin's dyslexic reporter and Jed's ugly kids. Llewellyn lost a pub quiz to Boycie when Tyler answered all of the questions correctly - much to the surprise of his parents. Mrs Cakeworthy started her on psychic sessions in the Manor House, and the Driscoll brothers found Boycie, with the help of Marlene's sister who had been dating them both. The Driscolls did not harm Boycie but stated that he and his family will be left untouched if they can use Boycie's land to hide something on. What they buried is still unknown.
â
[[Image:1.2 - A Rocky Start.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Rocky the Bull.]]
 
As the series has progressed, plots have become more humorous, characters have become more three-dimensional and rare but noticeable amounts of drama have slipped into episodes such as Marlene parting with her son as he went to university. The humour comes from several sources. The characters of Boycie and Marlene are key to the show with Boycie's machine gun laugh still a large feature, as is Marlene's suspected affair with Del Boy. Much is made of the traits of individual characters, such as Elgin's liking for Marlene, Bryanâs break-up with Myrtle, Llewellyn's hatred for Boycie, Mrs Cakeworthy's non-cleaning habits and the Rocky the gay bull story arc.

Line 128: Line 126:
==Characters==
==Characters==
{{main article|List of The Green Green Grass characters}}
{{main article|List of The Green Green Grass characters}}
â
[[Image:2.8 - From Here To Paternity.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Boycie after the events of [[From Here to Paternity]].]]
 
The main characters in ''The Green Green Grass'' are Aubrey (Boycie) and Marlene Boyce. They have one child, Tyler. They employ four members of staff, Elgin, Bryan, Jed and Imelda Cakeworthy. Tyler has a girlfriend, Beth. Beth is a regular until ''[[The Special Relationship]]'' in 2007. In [[List of The Green Green Grass episodes|Series Four]], Sara is introduced as Tylerâs new girlfriend.
